Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL ?; PAINTED
Name: Tray with cross
Description: This tray in red terracotta is decorated, in the middle, by a cross surrounded by two concentric circles. To the lateral branches the Greek letters "alpha" and "omega" are suspended, signifying that Christ is the beginning and the end of everything. The form of the tray is typically roman: a lip with flat edge, curved belly and small foot. The piece dates from the 5th or the 6th century.
